source.title: PCR Program

source.description:
Run PCR product on 1% gel to check for size and a single band.
If the PCR product is clean, single band, it can be purified.
If there is multiple bands, gel purify the fragment. Elute PCR product in
.

source.title: Colony PCR to check for the Insert

source.description: Use M13F (or T7F) primer and an insert specific primer (cdsR) to check for the size and direction of the insert.

source.body: IMPORTANT! Sometimes the insert could be inserted in the opposite direction.

source.title: Making a replica plate and adding template

source.description: Circle and number the colonies you wish to colony PCR (8-16 colonies).

source.title: Making a replica plate and adding template

source.description: Get a new selective plate and make a grid and number each cell = Replica Plate

source.title: Making a replica plate and adding template

source.description: Using a P20 pipet tip, gently touch the side of a single colony. Gently touch the corresponding grid on the replica plate, then place the pipet tip in the PCR tube containing your master mix.

source.title: Making a replica plate and adding template

source.description:
Incubate replica plate at
for a few hours or overnight.

source.title: Making a replica plate and adding template

source.description: Run PCR product on a gel to check for the presence of an insert in the correct orientation.

source.title: LB broth
PCR using M13 F/R primers to amplify fragment for LR reaction

source.description:
Necessary since the entry clone and the destination vector both have Kan resistance.
Use the Phusion protocol from Step 1
and M13F/R primers to amplify the fragment.
Use only 28 cycles since the PCR should be very strong.
Gel or PCR purify the fragment.

source.title: Transforming One Shot Top10 E. Coli competent cells

source.description: Thaw 1 vial of One Shot cells on ice and aliquot the cells into separate cells into separate PCR tubes, if necessary.

source.body: 1 vial can do 3 or 4 transformations, but it cannot be refrozen.

source.title: Transforming One Shot Top10 E. Coli competent cells

source.description: Add product to be transformed into One Shot cells and mix gently.

source.body: DO NOT mix by pipetting up and down.
